text: Harmon County is a county in the U.S. state of Oklahoma. As of 2020, 2,488 people lived there. The county seat is Hollis. It was named after Judson Harmon, the governor of Ohio at the time. ==History== It was created on June 2, 1909, from land that was previously owned by Greer County. After an election on September 1, the county seat became Hollis. == Geography == The county has a total area of 539 square miles. == References == Category:Oklahoma counties Category:1900s establishments in Oklahoma Category:1909 establishments in the United States
title: Harmon County, Oklahoma
